title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Write a program that displays a simple ASCII art (like a smiley face), but ADD COMMENTS explaining each line!

For example:
`// Top of the face`
`Console.WriteLine("  ^   ^  ");`
`// The mouth`
`Console.WriteLine("   ---   ");`

testCases.description: Output should display ASCII art using Console.WriteLine
Code should have multiple output statements

hints.text: Use `Console.WriteLine` for each line of your art, and add `//` comments above each line to explain it!
Forgetting that comments are for HUMANS, not the computer - they don't do anything to your code!
Using `/*` to start a comment but forgetting `*/` to close it - everything after becomes a comment!
Writing comments that just repeat the code: `// Display text` is not helpful. `// Display welcome message to user` is better!

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting that comments are for HUMANS
commonMistakes.consequence: They don't do anything to your code!
commonMistakes.correction: Review the lesson content and examples carefully.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using /* to start a comment but forgetting */ to close it
commonMistakes.correction: Review the lesson content and examples carefully.

commonMistakes.mistake: Writing comments that just repeat the code
commonMistakes.consequence: This creates clutter without adding value.
commonMistakes.correction: Review the correct syntax and best practices for this concept.
